What is the result of a successful `makeoffer` or `takeoffer` command in Verus?

The result of a successful `makeoffer` or `takeoffer` command is a JSON object with two possible fields: "txid" and "hex". "txid" contains the hexadecimal transaction ID of the transaction, while "hex" contains the hexadecimal serialization of the partial transaction, if requested.

#### Result:
```json
{
 "txid" : "transactionid", The hex transaction id on success
 "hex" : "serializedtx"  If hex is requested, hex serialization of partial transaction instead of txid is returned on success
}
```Examples:
```
> verus makeoffer fromaddress '{"changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "expiryheight":blockheight, "offer":{"currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"identity":"idnameoriaddress",...}', "for":{"address":..., "currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"name":"identityforswap","parent":"parentid","primaryaddresses":["R-address(s)"],"minimumsignatures":1,...}}' (returntx) (feeamount)
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "makeoffer", "params": [fromaddress '{"changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "expiryheight":blockheight, "offer":{"currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"identity":"idnameoriaddress",...}', "for":{"address":..., "currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"name":"identityforswap","parent":"parentid","primaryaddresses":["R-address(s)"],"minimumsignatures":1,...}}' (returntx) (feeamount)] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `takeoffer fromaddress '{"txid":"txid" | "tx":"hextx", "changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "deliver":"fullidnameoriaddresstodeliver" | {"currency":"currencynameorid","amount":n}, "accept":{"address":"addressorid","currency":"currencynameorid","amount"} | {identitydefinition}}' (returntx) (feeamount)`
If the current wallet can afford the swap, this accepts a swap offer on the blockchain, creates a transaction
to execute it, and posts the transaction to the blockchain.
How do I create a swap offer in Verus using the command line?

To create a swap offer in Verus using the command line, you can use the `makeoffer` command with the following format:

```
verus makeoffer fromaddress '{"changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "expiryheight":blockheight, "offer":{"currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"identity":"idnameoriaddress",...}', "for":{"address":..., "currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"name":"identityforswap","parent":"parentid","primaryaddresses":["R-address(s)"],"minimumsignatures":1,...}}' (returntx) (feeamount)
```

This command specifies the address to send from, the change address, the offer details, and the details of what you're offering in exchange.

#### Result:
```json
{
 "txid" : "transactionid", The hex transaction id on success
 "hex" : "serializedtx"  If hex is requested, hex serialization of partial transaction instead of txid is returned on success
}
```Examples:
```
> verus makeoffer fromaddress '{"changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "expiryheight":blockheight, "offer":{"currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"identity":"idnameoriaddress",...}', "for":{"address":..., "currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"name":"identityforswap","parent":"parentid","primaryaddresses":["R-address(s)"],"minimumsignatures":1,...}}' (returntx) (feeamount)
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "makeoffer", "params": [fromaddress '{"changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "expiryheight":blockheight, "offer":{"currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"identity":"idnameoriaddress",...}', "for":{"address":..., "currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"name":"identityforswap","parent":"parentid","primaryaddresses":["R-address(s)"],"minimumsignatures":1,...}}' (returntx) (feeamount)] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `takeoffer fromaddress '{"txid":"txid" | "tx":"hextx", "changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "deliver":"fullidnameoriaddresstodeliver" | {"currency":"currencynameorid","amount":n}, "accept":{"address":"addressorid","currency":"currencynameorid","amount"} | {identitydefinition}}' (returntx) (feeamount)`
If the current wallet can afford the swap, this accepts a swap offer on the blockchain, creates a transaction
to execute it, and posts the transaction to the blockchain.
How do I accept a swap offer in Verus using the command line?

To accept a swap offer in Verus using the command line, you can use the `takeoffer` command with the following format:

```
verus takeoffer fromaddress '{"txid":"txid" | "tx":"hextx", "changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "deliver":"fullidnameoriaddresstodeliver" | {"currency":"currencynameorid","amount":n}, "accept":{"address":"addressorid","currency":"currencynameorid","amount"} | {identitydefinition}}' (returntx) (feeamount)
```

This command specifies the address to send from, the transaction ID or hexadecimal transaction of the offer, the change address, what to deliver, and the details of what you're accepting in the swap.

#### Result:
```json
{
 "txid" : "transactionid", The hex transaction id on success
 "hex" : "serializedtx"  If hex is requested, hex serialization of partial transaction instead of txid is returned on success
}
```Examples:
```
> verus makeoffer fromaddress '{"changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "expiryheight":blockheight, "offer":{"currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"identity":"idnameoriaddress",...}', "for":{"address":..., "currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"name":"identityforswap","parent":"parentid","primaryaddresses":["R-address(s)"],"minimumsignatures":1,...}}' (returntx) (feeamount)
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "makeoffer", "params": [fromaddress '{"changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "expiryheight":blockheight, "offer":{"currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"identity":"idnameoriaddress",...}', "for":{"address":..., "currency":"anycurrency", "amount":...} | {"name":"identityforswap","parent":"parentid","primaryaddresses":["R-address(s)"],"minimumsignatures":1,...}}' (returntx) (feeamount)] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `takeoffer fromaddress '{"txid":"txid" | "tx":"hextx", "changeaddress":"transparentoriaddress", "deliver":"fullidnameoriaddresstodeliver" | {"currency":"currencynameorid","amount":n}, "accept":{"address":"addressorid","currency":"currencynameorid","amount"} | {identitydefinition}}' (returntx) (feeamount)`
If the current wallet can afford the swap, this accepts a swap offer on the blockchain, creates a transaction
to execute it, and posts the transaction to the blockchain.
